mcqs.question: What is the problem with measuring distances in the RGB color space?

options.A: RGB color space cannot represent distances of colors with high luminance
options.B: Distances in RGB space do not correspond to physical color differences
options.C: Measuring distances in RGB space is computationally inefficient
options.D: RGB space lacks the ability to represent transparent color differences
options.E: Distances in RGB space do not correspond to perceived color differences

mcqs.question: What happens to the surface brightness if the distance between the surface and the light source is doubled?

options.E: The brightness decreases to 1/4 of the original

mcqs.question: Why can't the sRGB color space reproduce all visible colors?

options.A: Because the sRGB primaries are positioned within the chromaticity diagram, restricting reproducible colors to those inside the triangle they define
options.B: Because sRGB uses a limited bit depth, preventing it from representing a wide range of colors accurately
options.C: Because sRGB relies on outdated color measurement techniques, reducing its ability to cover the full spectrum of visible colors
options.D: Because sRGB does not include a luminance component, making it unable to represent certain shades and tints
options.E: Because sRGB is optimized for print media, which limits its effectiveness on digital displays

mcqs.question: Color is typically described using three primaries, but why do we only need two parameters to represent chromaticity?

options.A: Because human vision merges two of the tristimulus values into a single dimension, leaving only two separate parameters to describe color fully
options.B: Because two parameters are chosen for mathematical simplicity, even though all three primaries remain independently significant to color perception
options.C: Because defining chromaticity traditionally omits the blue primary, reducing the necessary dimensions from three to two
options.D: Because chromaticity is defined by normalizing the three tristimulus values by their sum, making one coordinate dependent on the other two
options.E: Because one of the primaries always remains constant, removing the need for a third parameter in describing chromaticity

mcqs.question: What does a specular highlight represent?

options.A: A scattering of light in all directions from a matte surface
options.B: A reflection of the light source on a highly polished surface
options.C: A refraction of light through a transparent object
options.D: A shadow cast by an object when light is blocked
options.E: A reflection of the light source on a rough surface

mcqs.question: Why are color histograms invariant to spatial transformations such as translation and rotation?

options.A: Because color histograms prioritize central image colors, reducing the impact of surrounding areas during spatial transformations
options.B: Because color histograms adjust color values based on geometric transformations, compensating for any changes in position or orientation
options.C: Because color histograms utilize transformation-invariant features that realign colors after any spatial modification
options.D: Because color histograms ignore the spatial arrangement of pixels and focus solely on the distribution of colors
options.E: Because color histograms encode the exact positions of colors within the image, ensuring consistency even when the image is rotated or translated

options.C: By adjusting the color temperature of three primary colors until the test color is matched

options.A: The tristimulus values of the green primary become positive between 450 and 550 nm

options.C: The tristimulus values of the blue primary become negative between 450 and 550 nm
options.D: The tristimulus values of all primaries become negative between 450 and 550 nm
options.E: The tristimulus values of the red primary become negative between 450 and 550 nm

mcqs.question: How is color temperature related to black body radiation?

options.A: Color temperature is the temperature at which a black body emits light of all colors

options.C: Color temperature is the temperature at which a black body reflects all incident light
